content.description: This problem is a direct version to The Great Escape, cutting up on to the slab face mid way through the bottom cave traverse.
content.location: Begin in the bottom corner under the left face and traverse left slightly under halfway.  From there cut up using a small crimp and block hold, eventually connecting into the nice cracks and topping out same as The Great Escape.

content.description: A short interesting problem finishing up through a rock hole to squeeze through.
content.location: Start on a right hand crimp and left hand side pull, deep in the entrance side of the cave where the water pools up and there is a jumble of sticks for a landing. Make your way up to the ledge and reach up and out of the hole.

content.description: A really fun, smooth, slightly tight problem working through some smooth holds and fun movement. (Be careful of the landing, because it may be hard to fit pads without constantly rubbing up against them while climbing).
content.protection: Pads on bottom pad less in crevasse
content.location: Located on the right side of the cave on the bottom floor.  Start on the clear ledge connecting to the entrance platform and traverse left/deeper into the cave until you reach a vertical crack.  Trek your way up the crack and to the top ledge.  Top out up and over the peak of the wall.

content.description: Longer version of Ready or Not making your way up and over the entrance rock. It’s kind of a rock scrambling boulder problem, but has fun movement.
content.location: Start deep in the stick pile section of the cave, same as Ready or Not and once again make your way up to the ledge.  Shoot up to the connection holds of The Great Escape and traverse left, topping out over the entrance boulder on your left when walking in.

content.description: This problem is pretty much a stemming chimney problem utilizing both of the main faces to make your way to the top.
content.location: Start in the bottom corner under the left face transition yourself over to the right face where Hide and Seek begins.  From there utilize both faces to stem your way to the peak, topping out over the right face.

content.description: A fun flowy 2 part problem on the left side of the cave. Traverse through some nice ledge holds into a transitionn point eventually leading into gorgeous crack ledges on the slab main face.
content.location: Located on the left side of the cave, starting at the bottom floor as deep in from the entrance as possible.  Traverse along some nice flat ledges below the roof to the left side of the problem and reach up into the transition section.  From there begin traversing right into some very nice crack ledges onto the slab, topping out at the peak of the boulder.

content.description: A secret area that is very easy to miss. Consists of a few small rocks sticking out of the ground with little to no apparent potential until you walk up to them. When you walk up to them at the right angle it drops down and opens up to a cave with a couple of beautiful faces consisting of some fantastic climbs.
